metadata.title: CVE-2020-11993 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.20 to 2.4.43 When trace/debug was enabledfor the HTTP/2 module and on certain traffic edge patterns, loggingstatements were made on the wrong connection, causing concurrent use ofmemory pools. Configuring the LogLevel of mod_http2 above "info" willmitigate this vulnerability for unpatched servers.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
